page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {LIDDINGTON HILL _}A univallate iron age hill fort of 7.5 acres, 910 ft. above sea level. It is 4.5 miles from Swindon, 7.5 miles from Marlborough. At its summit is a concrete observation box with steps leading into a chamber. This is one of a chain of observation posts built during the Second World War. Liddington Hill is not a public monument. Constant erosion by cattle grazing on the hill is causing some concern as the structure of the hill is slowly being reduced. {THE MANOR _ UPPER UPHAM _}Built in the 16th century by the Goddard Family of Upham on the site of an earlier building, said to be the hunting lodge of{John of Gaunt}who came to the area to hunt the Aldbourne Chase. It is a house of flint and stone with mullioned windows and 2 storey porch.
